properties.Name: DunBradstreetCompositeCreditAppraisal
properties.Description:
The Dun Bradstreet Credit Appraisal is rated:

1 = High

Very low change of business failure and will usually pay all obligations within terms.

Payments: Satisfactory, suitable explanations for any slowness 

Finance: Statements regularly obtained
Usually comparative figures
Strong condition
Upward trend 

History: One year back, at least;
three years preferably
Adequate assurance of ownership

Antecedents: Experienced in all aspects of business management
No recent business failures, felony, conviction, etc., that would have serious impact on business

2 = Good

Low change of business failure and will usually pay all obligations within terms.

Payments: Generally satisfactory, suitable explanation for slowness 

Finance: Statements obtained 
Sound Condition
Trend Usually favorable

History: No minimum years if other factors satisfactory
Adequate assurance of ownership

Antecedents: If new, previous experience in line or in successfully managing a previous business
No recent business failures, felony, conviction, etc., that would have serious impact on business

3 =Fair

 Moderate change of business failure and/or will usually pay all obligations slow.

Payments: Significant slowness 

Finance: Statement obtained
Condition unbalanced
Operating Losses
Impaired Cash flow
Heavy debt

History: Adequate assurance of ownership

Antecedents: May lack balanced experience, or experience in line
Consider impact on business of any recent business failures or felony convictions

4 = Limited 

Higher chance of business failure and/or will usually pay all obligations slow.

Payments: Even greater elements of risk, credit worthiness limited

Finance: Significant, even chronic slowness 

History: Adequate assurance of ownership

Antecedents: May lack balanced experience, or experience in line
Consider impact on business of any recent business failures or felony convictions

The Composite Credit Appraisal is a number, 1 through 4, that makes up the second half of the company's Rating and reflects D&B's overall assessment of that firm's creditworthiness. 

The "2", "3", or "4" Composite Credit Appraisal is based on analysis by D&B of company payments, public records, business age and other important factors. A "2" is the highest Composite Credit Appraisal a company not supplying D&B with current financial information can receive.

Columns.Name: DunBradstreetCompositeCreditAppraisalId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Dun Bradstreet Composite Credit Appraisal rating.

Columns.Name: DunBradstreetCompositeCreditAppraisalName
Columns.Description: The name of a Dun Bradstreet Composite Credit Appraisal rating.

Columns.Name: DunBradstreetCompositeCreditAppraisalDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Dun Bradstreet Composite Credit Appraisal rating.
